title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC (Bengaluru)
Interview Descriptions: General interview regarding yourself and few situation based questions to test your decision making ability and assess your personality accordingly to assign you a department based on your profile, strengths and interests.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC (Mumbai)
Interview Descriptions: The personality test was the first round based on that screening round with the Vice president. The assignment and last round were with the president. Each interview lasted for more than 30min
Interview Questions: Sell wifi to your grandmother

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC (New Delhi)
Interview Descriptions: It was great, mostly they took from your previous experiences and wanted to know how you take initiative in a team setting. Don't talk unless asked a question. Make sure to be honest and expressive, you are good to go.
Interview Questions: 1. tell me about yourself 2. Talk to me about a time where u overcame a challenge 3. Fav marketing campaign

title: Product Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: It was nice i was asked about puzzles and situation based question. I was happy with my interview and was finally selected for the role. in the end it was an amazing experience I worked there. Good work environment
Interview Questions: hobbies puzzles situational questions apti

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: It was a thrilling experience! They talked about important topics and the entire process made me aware about my own self. The HR was super sweet and made me feel comfortable
Interview Questions: What social issue do you care about the most, globally or locally? Tell us your opinion about the issue! What do you do in your daily basis to solve it?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: My experience was great and i learnt a lot from the things  the experience i had. I got to explore my potential and creativity. The Interview process was very nice
Interview Questions: People you look up to and Why?

title: VP Business Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: All in all it was a smooth interview process and had quite a good amount of psychology based questions, also they judge you a little on your profile. Communication is judged majorly since the role requires that to be of a good notch.
Interview Questions: Difference between you & your classmates.

title: Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions:
Started with GD, then 2 interview rounds.
The final interview was with the president.

Not everyone is selected in the GD, and there are more rounds if they feel you are suited for a certain department
Interview Questions: Generic HR questions ranging from hobbies to future aspirations

title: BDE - Business Development Executive Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: A simple interview on day-to-day event management handling. Scenario-based questions, to check your problem solving skills and confidence. They mainly try to gain your perspective on multiple topics, to try and understand your personality, and whether or not you have the capability to sell a product to an individual.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a scenario where the speaker of the event backs out at the very last moment, due to explainable reasons?

title: Regional Finance Head Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: It was a good process. They asked a lot of diverse questions and had assessed me on the basis of my technical and behavioural abilities.Overall the experience was a good learning.
Interview Questions: Sell me this pen I have

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was based on 3 rounds
1. Resume screening 
2. Interview - interview for skill testing
3. HR Interview - personal interview 
Post which we received a confirmation about the position.
Interview Questions: Q. What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: The first stage was a group discussion, with questions based on innovative ideas, under pressure behaviour, and speaking skills,  the 2nd a personal interview, where knowledge on sustainable development goals is checked along with information about your self and interest in the company
Interview Questions: Q Do you know what sustainable development goals are? How many are there? And could you tell me your favourite?

title: Interview Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: It was good. They asked basic questions. Be confident, honest and chill. Don't stress out. They might ask you to sell something. Strengths and weakness and what motivates you can be asked.
Interview Questions: What is AIESEC? What qualities will you offer us?

title: Client Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: be authentic, they will ask mostly behavioural and situational questions. apart from that they might give a few conflict based questions which you will have to answer. know which department you want to go to too.
Interview Questions: try to sell a paratha

title: Marketing Department Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at AIESEC in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Online interview Two interviewers and two interviewees Chance by chance questioning One or both people may get selected Total interview time was thirty minutes Interview was followed by a QnA session
Interview Questions: Your goal as part of the company

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions:
Group Discussion on either current affair or abstract topics like "red vs blue"' 
Personnel Interview, mainly discussing your resume & profile related questions. There will be situations related questions as well.
Interview Questions:
About myself
Previous experience
Profile related questions.

title: Local Product Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: Group Discussion, Personal Interview . They asked personal questions and then tested communication skills and asked professional questions. It was simple, not that hard . I liked the way they asked the questions
Interview Questions:
Experience ?
Skills ?
Potential ?
Communication ?
etc.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: They test communication skills mainly and the passion with which you are willing to work in the organisation, people might ask you weird questions but there's no right or wrong
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself was the first question

title: Business Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 rounds. First round was group discussion. Second round was an activity in which we were required to form teams and pitch for funding for a product of our choosing. Third round was an HR interview.
Interview Questions: why do you want to join aiesec?

title: Software Engineer(Internship) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at AIESEC (At) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Pretty Good, majority of the questions were about the technology that I have worked upon. The interviewer was also very friendly & he explained the problem in very easy words, which helped me gain more confidence while answering questions.
Interview Questions: What is Node.js? Types of Authentication strategies & implementing them.

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: The process was very professional, and very efficient - they give feedback when rejected as well. It was ensured that people are able to express themselves and pushes you out of your comfort zone.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths & weaknesses?

title: Corporate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Aiesec in IIT Delhi. Three-stage interview process. First is GD. In the second one we are put in a group and asked to find a business idea in 10 mins, every participant has become CFO, CEO, CMO and HR.
Interview Questions: intro, fav music, why here etc.

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at AIESEC (New Delhi) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: 1st round was general aptitude and then the 2nd interview was of speech test and the last was 3rd round the personal interview in which you have to show that how can you convince someone of something.
Interview Questions: if you have to convince someone for the internship in foreign then how will you do that?

title: Business Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: There will be 2 tasks given to you before interview .Interview is of 30 minutes and they ask you Basic questions and check whether your values match the company or not. Also, They will give you various situations and you will have to answer them.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself?

title: Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at AIESEC (New Delhi) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: The application form consists of a questions that are about your plan as a TL. The interview has a pretty much the same questions with a couple of technical questions as well. You must be well aware of the product of the department you are applying for.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: General Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: Asked a lot of real-life experience-based and practical questions. Most of them were about self-reflection and work ethics. The interviewer was warm and forthcoming in nature. The process took about 30 mins in total.
Interview Questions: Are you an empathetic person?

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at AIESEC (Hyderābād) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
One round of interviews. 
Basic questions to get to know you as a person, your skills, potential, qualities, etc.
It ended with a small assignment.
One suggestion is to be honest and confident. It's one and only way to crack the interview.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
What are your strengths and weakness?
What do you know about AIESEC?
Questions based on assignment?
Critical thinking question

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions:
The process was that we had one round of group discussion and then a round of Personal Interviews. 
After the interviews, we were called for induction and were oriented into the entire organisation.
Interview Questions: Sell wifi to your grandmother

title: Manager ( U Get Selected As Per Your Performance) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at AIESEC (New Delhi)
Interview Descriptions: Asked a couple of common interview questions like tell me Something about yourself, sell yourself to me ,  why shouldn't I hire you or tell some positive traits about you etc etc.
Interview Questions: Sell yourself to me ( this organisation)

title: Business Decelopment Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC (Mumbai) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was easy. The interviewee was very friendly. The questions asked were based on what you said. Very warm and welcoming. They even asked me to sing.  We have a sales pitch for any object they show.  It’s an easy interview to get through
Interview Questions: Try and sell this broken pen to me.

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at AIESEC (New Delhi) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: First Round is  Group Discussion then there is a Team Activity if you qualify both then you go through the Personal Interview. The results are announced after weeks, it will take an entire day so be prepared. the GD takes 20 minutes, then the TA takes 20 minutes and the final PA is for like 10 minutes but there is a lot of waiting time in between .
Interview Questions: How do you explain colours to a blind person?

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions:
- Highly Interactive
- No rigid structure
- Very friendly

The interview panel were very communicative regarding their wants and wanted to specifically know how my personal goals will align with AIESEC's goals in order to make sure I develop both professionally and personally?
Interview Questions: Would you rather prefer to execute a task before a deadline or would you rather work along with your teammates to help everyone complete their deadline on time?

title: Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: Easy with a few questions asked. questions asked were about my life , past experience , contribution etc and how i can bring a change to the world but i answred well
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Business Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at AIESEC (Patiala) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: General questions, evaluating past work and skills , the spontaneity of the candidate was checked apart from the communication skill and personality of the candidate, the interview was very formal and it was expected by the panel that candidate was willing to contribute towards the organization.
Interview Questions: What kind of football position would you prefer and why?

title: Community Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at AIESEC (Mumbai) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: First there was induction round , then they started with the one on one personal interview where critical questions were asked mainly to judge the personality of the candidate. Then there was the 2nd round where make or break question was asked and thats the end of interview.
Interview Questions: why should we not hire you

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC (Pune) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: The Interview process was on a video call.  The employer was friendly. The questions asked were easy and related to the Project. The interview was planned according to the time of both the company and myself.
Interview Questions: Questions Related to my English Skills as the Job was a speaking Clun Instructor.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: A CV screening will always will be there.You should be very good with the CV.After that a pre interview will be there with Aiesec people.After that if you selected you will be interviewed by that company.
Interview Questions: Most depressing moment of your life?

title: OGV EP Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at AIESEC (Chennai) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was well structured and the questions asked were insightful. It started off with simple personality questions and later moved on to more task oriented questions. Certain situations were presented and I was asked how would I solve them.
Interview Questions: Asked me about my previous experiences if any.

title: Business Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at AIESEC (Navi Mumbai) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: We were called to a cafe where there were 2 rounds of interviews taken it is very comfortable and the interviewer made me feel very comfortable, the culture of AIESEC, What does AIESEC do .
Interview Questions: what do want to take away from AIESEC

title: Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: It was beautiful. I was pushed to the limit but it turned out to be amazing and I was selected for the department I wanted to join. I am very happy in the organization.
Interview Questions: Q: Where do you see yourself five years from now?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at AIESEC in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Hassle free and swift process. The recruiter was highly skilled and helped me throughout the process. All I had to do was submit an application with my CV, it was then shortlisted and I had to give an online interview, got the result on the same day.
Interview Questions: Are you available on certain dates?

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at AIESEC (New Delhi) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: very good, easy process. HR made me feel comfortable and made sure I was not nervous. The environment was not intimidating.  everything was pretty good honestly.  Everyone seemed pretty nice.
Interview Questions: Don't remember the questions as such.

title: Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at AIESEC in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: They just want to know your intention and how keen you are to join the organisation also how do you skills and mindset matches with the people of the organisation
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join AIESEC

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at AIESEC (Jalandhar, Punjab) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: One of the best interviews I've gone through. Let's you renovate and refine your plans and ideas.Makes you mentally and emotionally strong.The toughness is vital as the chance is golden and powerful.The experience is amazing.
Interview Questions: Why does AIESEC operate when there's no issue of world war III?

title: Customer Experience Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at AIESEC (Vellore) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
First round - sending the application by answering the question within deadline 
Second round - once application selected , 
interview with the MCVP
The interview was generally based on testing the background , previous work experience , skills acquired in it , CV check etc
Once selected , will receive a mail from the interviewer within 2 days on whether accepted or not .
Interview Questions: 2nd round - questions generally on interpersonal skills and that required for the the job role applied

title: Sales Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at AIESEC (Hyderābād) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: 3 Rounds consisting of GD, and 2 interviews which takes a whole day to complete. Every round filters people, it's a decent experience and the rounds can be tense at times. However, the volunteers do their bit towards making you feel welcome.
Interview Questions: How would your friends describe your family?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at AIESEC (Manipal) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was held on Skype. Friendly people and very comfortable. Asked general questions about the project and myself. This was for Warsaw, Poland, regarding the United Nations 17 sustainable development goals.
Interview Questions: Why should we select you? What do you know about the United Nations 17 sustainable development goals.

title: Global Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC (New Delhi) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Firstly I applied in the AIESEC site requesting for a volunteering opportunity and then I was shortlisted for a program in China. Then there was an interview about my background , interests and ideology through a Skype call and I was selected.
Interview Questions: What do you know about China?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at AIESEC (Chennai) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a skype interview. It went smoothly, my interviewer was very friendly and welcoming, asked me about my previous volunteering experiences, and why I wanted to join the program.
Interview Questions: Why do you wanna join our program?

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at AIESEC (Ahmedabad) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: the interview was tough. it startes with personal questions and ends at technical level. basically they want to know the priority of urs and why you want to join AIESEC.  how will you help the org. to achive the goal. and for how long time will u be able to be part of this org. thus the interview was 2 hours long, the questions were logical and good
Interview Questions:
sell a book
tell me about yourself

title: Associate Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at AIESEC (Bengaluru)
Interview Descriptions: In the Am program, I had to fulfill a certain number of tasks over the course of 6 weeks. If I've done it satisfactorily, I'll get selected. I had to sell tickets for one of their events to people and do general grunt work suck as picking up an international from the airport and so on.
Interview Questions: I went through the AM program and not through the recruitment drive. Hence I bypassed all this.

title: Vice President H Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at AIESEC in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: One first needs recommendation letters to be qualified to apply. There are multiple levels of screening which include psychometric tests, tasks, application questionnaire, vote of confidence, and then group interview.
Interview Questions: Attitude, portfolio/experience, situational leadership and ability to work in team were among the main questions.

title: MC Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at AIESEC (New Delhi) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: First, they conducted a Group discussion which was quite easy then we proceeded for Team assignment in which they divided us into teams of 5 and we were given a task to come up with a product which was socially relevant in 7 minutes and then present the various aspects of the product to them and those who cleared this round were called for a personal interview.
Interview Questions:
Why do you think you are fit for Aiesec?
What will you do to sell coke to CEO of Pepsi

title: Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at AIESEC (Mumbai)
Interview Descriptions: It was a fun interview and a group discussion followed. In the interview they mainly looked for willingness to work hard, time availability to volunteer for AIESEC activities and willingness to travel. There were three panelists in the interview. As for the group discussion it was with a bunch of 10 other potential recruits. It was tough with some macro topics for discussions. The idea there was not to hog speaking time completely, but to ensure your presence is felt by summarizing, guiding, facilitating the discussion.
Interview Questions: Will you be willing to travel across Mumbai for AIESEC activities.

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at AIESEC (Patiala) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process begins with filling the application form where several questions need to be answered. Next is completing tasks which are assigned to you within a span of time and finally personal interview gets scheduled.
Interview Questions: Why should we get you on board?

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at AIESEC (Kharagpur, West Bengal) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: It contained questions pertaining to the selling and convincing skills of the applicant. The questions, some of them were illogical, while others made some good sense. The organisation seniorrs failed to quench some doubts, as they themselves didn't know the full form of AIESEC
Interview Questions: They asked me about my interests

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at AIESEC (Chandigarh) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: An amazing process, crisp and jaw-dropping experience that asked me some deep questions about how I want to grow and where I want to see myself. Amazing leadership development through the selection process.
Interview Questions: What do you want to build in the world?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is quite simple,its a two step hiring process,initially there would be a group discussion where in the candidates are screened and are allowed to go to the next round being the personal interview round,your character your strength,weakness are counted for before being selected as an intern or even an team member in which case you are scrutinized further.
Interview Questions: how would you explain the colour green to a blind person.

title: Corporate Sales Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at AIESEC (New Delhi) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
There are 3 rounds. 
First is group discussion, 
followed by a team activity, 
then final interview.
Group discussion will have 2 topics, 1 abstract and 1 general.
Team activity is to check people under stress condition.
Personal interview is easy.
Interview Questions: General questions, tell me something about yourself

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at AIESEC (Hyderābād) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: It took an entire day and an additional week to go through. The management was quite good. The entire process was properly delegated and processed well. The interview was conducted in 3 rounds, Group discussion, Team task and personal interview.
Interview Questions: My interests and hobbies.

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at AIESEC (Chandigarh) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
keeping it quite simple here, we had the following 
1. debate/ group discussion
be opiniated, speak up, dont cut in or shout.
2. team activities
show leadership, be vocal and think fast and construct efficently
3. personal interview with a VP
be honest and they'd want to know your schedule and behaviour
4. final interview with the president
just be original 

show that you have time to spare if you want in.
Interview Questions: why should we choose you?

title: Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: AIESEC
Interview Questions: How do you explain a colour to a blind person?

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at AIESEC (Jaipur, Rajasthan) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interviews are taken by the vice-presidents of different departments of the local committee. I was called upon by an existing member of the HR department to appear for the interview on a Sunday morning. I reached the office and was called upon within 5 minutes. My interviewer was just a couple of years older. He requested me to be truthful and not panic. My interview lasted 15 minutes. The interviewer praised me and told me that I would be contacted by the HR people if I am selected in a couple of days.
Interview Questions:
The questions were very general:
What do you know about the organization?
How would you manage your studies and office work?
How confident are you while speaking to other people especially the foreigners?
Why should we hire you?

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AIESEC (Hyderābād) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Moderate. The interview focused more on problem solving skills There were 3 interview rounds. The first round was a group interview followed by a one on one interview. Later there was a group discussion the process mainly focused on checking ones performance as a team.After the final round it took 2 weeks to get a confirmation.
Interview Questions: Just a minute, group discussion on trending topics

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at AIESEC (Ahmedabad) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: they analyse your personality , test your communication skills, asks you a puzzle or problem to solve , effective way of interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Team Leader, Development Sector Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at AIESEC (Visakhapatnam) in Feb 2013
Interview Questions: Selling a painting to a blind person

title: Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at AIESEC (Surat) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Good people
tough interview
Interview Questions: How to explain green color to blind person?

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at AIESEC (New Delhi) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
You have group discussion followed by a group activity. If you qualify both you have a 1 on 1 interview.
There could be errors as 1000s apply, so keep following up with recruitment team.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join?

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at AIESEC (Mumbai) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Great organisation for young individual to enhance and develop their career, interview depends from local chapter to local chapter and need to have basic understanding of the departments and the core value of the organisation.

They also check your compatibility with other members of the executive body and the other department knowledge that you have. 

Lastly its very important to be clear that you will need to give a lot of time for this role throughout the year.
Interview Questions: What are the numbers of exchanges you want to achieve ? and how ?

title: Member Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at AIESEC (Calcutta) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was a little flawed since the applicants did not have a through idea of what its all about. more publicity is required for it to succees
Interview Questions: Sell the Blackberry Phone to a grocery shop owner who is not tech savvy?

title: To Join As A Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at AIESEC (Chandigarh) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
interviews were good , and it was a nice experience. it was my first interview ever , so i  was little nervous , but the interviewer makes you feel comfortable.
just be calm , composite and confident , it will be a cake walk....
Interview Questions: why are you different from others ?

title: OGX Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at AIESEC (New Delhi) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: first came group discussion which was followed by advertisement challenge and finally there was interview... all nic !
Interview Questions: during interview the questions asked were nice and upto the mark,.. quite creative n explainatory questions.!
